results.title: Safety in ceramics
results.creator_credit: Moorabbin College of TAFE and K Starbuck
results.brief_description: Introduces basic safety precautions for a ceramic studio when using clay as a creative medium in the classroom. Addresses safety and health hazards inherent in clay dust, the kiln, glazes, electricity and tools.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Moorabbin College of TAFE and K Starbuck

results.title: Safety depends on you
results.brief_description: Covers all general hand tool safety precautions including carrying, handling, use and storage. Hazards of improper acts - then correct methods are demonstrated.
results.description: Covers all general hand tool safety precautions including carrying, handling, use and storage. Hazards of improper acts - then correct methods are demonstrated.

results.title: Safety demonstration on the band saw
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Associates, E P Research and Robert L Wilkens
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the operation of a band saw and the basic safety procedures to follow when using it. Explains the different cuts, and use of various holding devices.

results.title: Safety begins at home
results.brief_description: Shows the correct and safe way in which to use common household appliance such as a penknife, stepladder, electrical apparatus, gas ovens, etc.

results.title: Safe Skateboarding
results.creator_credit: American Educational Films, Robert Springer and Billy Emmerson
results.brief_description: Outlines safety procedures and regulations regarding skateboard use. Includes information on maintenance of the board, riding techniques and protective clothing. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Safe in the water
results.brief_description: Water should be fun and if the rules are observed you can be safe in the water. Dramatised episodes show the most frequent causes of water accidents involving children. Details precautions that should be taken, and rescue techniques. Emphasises the importance of learning to swim at an early age. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Water should be fun and if the rules are observed you can be safe in the water. Dramatised episodes show the most frequent causes of water accidents involving children. results.title: Safe in the snow
results.creator_credit: Cinesound, British Petroleum and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: The ski rescue service is made up of volunteers, well-trained in search and rescue, first aid and transportation of the injured. Shows the work of the safety patrols in the winter, and sports centres in New South Wales and Victoria. Stresses the need for suitable clothing, well made skis and adequate care when skiing.

results.title: Safe in nature
results.brief_description: Dramatizes two examples of young people getting lost in the woods and in the desert, pointing out what the people did wrong while lost and what they should have done. Information is given on conserving energy and body moisture as well as many other aspects of bushcraft for survival

results.title: Safe handling of food in quantity
results.creator_credit: New York State College of Home Economics and Richard Turner
results.brief_description: Discusses food poisoning and measures to prevent it for those employed in handling food. Demonstrates control of bacteria by avoiding contamination, temperature regulation and chemical methods.
